summary: This is a letter from the U.S. Attorney's Office for the Southern District of New York to defense counsel in the case of United States v. Ghislaine Maxwell. It informs them of a reproduction of discovery materials due to a prior Bates stamping error, specifically Deutsche Bank and UBS financial records related to Jeffrey Epstein.

persons.name: Ghislaine Maxwell
persons.context: The defendant in the criminal case referenced in the letter (United States v. Ghislaine Maxwell, 20 Cr. 330 (MN)).

persons.name: Jeffrey Epstein
persons.context: The Deutsche Bank materials being reproduced are described as 'relating to Jeffrey Epstein'.

persons.name: Audrey Strauss
persons.context: The signatory of the letter, identified as the Acting United States Attorney for the Southern District of New York.

connections.description: The document is part of the discovery in Maxwell's criminal case, and the reproduced materials include financial records relating to Epstein, indicating their connection is central to the investigation.

events.title: UBS Subpoena Return
events.description: A subpoena return from UBS bank, dated December 15, 2020, is listed as part of the reproduced discovery materials.

events.title: Government Reproduces Discovery
events.description: The U.S. Attorney's Office reproduces and sends corrected discovery materials to Ghislaine Maxwell's defense counsel due to a prior Bates stamping error.

keyFacts: The U.S. Attorney's Office discovered and corrected an inadvertent Bates stamping error in prior discovery productions for the Ghislaine Maxwell case.
The reproduced materials include Deutsche Bank records relating to Jeffrey Epstein and a UBS subpoena return from December 15, 2020.
The corrected control numbers for the discovery batch are SDNY GM 02742184 through SDNY GM 02742302.
The letter confirms the government's ongoing discovery obligations in the case United States v. Ghislaine Maxwell (20 Cr. 330).
